column2: Comments
{ascan_dataset} or {sequence} (for MFMC compatibility)
content : 'ASCAN_DATASET' or 'SEQUENCE'
introduced for MFMC 2.0 compatibility
can be either an array or a reference to an array
introduced for MFMC_compatibility,if absent,N_Pos<m>=N_DF<m> is assumed
introduced for MFMC_compatibility,if present,overrides ./{setup}/{geometric_setup}/{acquisition_trajectory}
introduced for MFMC_compatibility,if present,overrides ./{setup}/{geometric_setup}/{acquisition_trajectory}
introduced for MFMC_compatibility,if present,overrides ./{setup}/{geometric_setup}/{acquisition_trajectory}
introduced for MFMC_compatibility,if present,overrides ./{setup}/{electronic_setup}/TRANSMIT_LAW
introduced for MFMC_compatibility,if present,overrides ./{setup}/{electronic_setup}/RECEIVE_LAW
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if present overrides ./{setup}/{geometric_setup}/PROBE_LIST
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if present overrides ./{setup}/{electronic_setup}/SAMPLING_FREQUENCY
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if present overrides ./{setup}/{electronic_setup}/START_TIME
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if present overrides ./{setup}/{electronic_setup}/GAIN
introduced for MFMC compatibility
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if  present,overrides ./{setup}/{geometric_setup}/{component}/VELOCITIES
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if  present,overrides ./{setup}/{geometric_setup}/{probe}/VELOCITIES
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if present overrides ./{setup}/{electronic_setup}/FILTER_TYPE
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if present overrides ./{setup}/{electronic_setup}/FILTER_PARAMETERS
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if present overrides ./{setup}/{electronic_setup}/FILTER_DESCRIPTION
can be either an array or a reference to an array
frame associated with the center of the image zone
physical dimension of the zone
number of pixels of the zone
optional reference to the elementary channels ascans that were used for the reconstruction
references to arrays containing the different values stored in the dataset
string defining the stored data - the name can be either custom  (MY_MATERIAL_PROPERTY for instance) or a standardized name : THICKNESS, TIME_OF_FLIGHT, DEPTH, AMAX
reference to the dataset containing the underlying data

Correspondancy between the C-Scanscalar data and the scan originating. For a A-Scan, the scan is expressed in terms of (dataframe, law). For a 2D Tscan, it will be (dataframe, column), for a 3D Tscan, it will be (dataframe, plane, column)
For scalar data relying on Ascan data, defines the start time for the gate. Mandatory for data related to Ascans.
For Cscans scalar data relying on Ascan data, defines the width of the gate. Mandatory for data related to Ascans
Defines the threshold of the gate for data to be stored
Mandatory for Ascan sequences
Reference to the inspected component. If missing, semi-infinite half plane is assumed, with interface at z=0 and material for z>0
List all probes used in the acquisition of the dataset
References  to the block describing the trajectory - references have the same order as PROBE_LIST
Offset and direction of the probe w.r.t the trajectory frame- identity  is assumed if not provided
Mandatory if SHAPE is PLATE
Mandatory if SHAPE is CYLINDER
Mandatory if shape is EXTRUSION_CAD
Mandatory if shape is EXTRUSION_CAD
Mandatory if shape is EXTRUSION_CAD or 3D_CAD
Optional CAD used for visualisation purposes
Definition of the frame defining the visualisation CAD with offset and quaternions in the specimen frame- Identity is used if absent
Definition of the specimen frame in the reference frame. If not provided, default value is identity with the reference frame.
Array defining the location of the elements of the probe
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if present overrides ELEMENT_FRAME
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if present overrides ELEMENT_FRAME and ELEMENT_SIZE
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if present overrides ELEMENT_FRAME and ELEMENT_SIZE
The shape of each element will be defined as one of the following: rectangle (ELE_GEOM_REC), part of a ring (ELE_GEOM_RING_PART), part of an elliptical ring (ELE_GEOM_ELLIPSE_PART),
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if present overrides INDEX_POINT_FRAME
introduced for MFMC compatibility,if present overrides INDEX_POINT_FRAME
Datafield of logical values (0 = false, 1 = true) used to flag non-functioning elements in an array probe (if not present, assumption should be that all elements are performing correctly)
String defining the stored data - the name can be either custom  (MY_MATERIAL_PROPERTY for instance) or a standardized name : THICKNESS, TIME_OF_FLIGHT, DEPTH, AMAX
Defines the  type of coupling : IMMERSION  for a liquid medium, WEDGE as a delay line, DIRECT for a coupling without a wedge
Mandatory if COUPLING_TYPE is defined
Mandatory if COUPLING_TYPE is defined
Mandatory if COUPLING_TYPE is defined
Defines the element numbering relating the numbering implicitly defined by the probe description and the order defined in the element tables (ELEMENT_POSITION, ELEMENT_GEOMETRY, etc)
Defines the shape of the surface on which the elements are arranged

Multi values : value in mm - FLAT : no value - CYLINDRICAL_INC, CYLINDRICAL_PER : Surface radius - SPHERICAL : Surface radius - BIFOCAL : Surface radius in the incidence plane, surface radius in the plane perpendicular to the incidence plane - TRIFOCAL : Surface radius in the incidence plane (bottom), Surface radius in the incidence plane (top), surface radius in the plane perpendicular to the incidence plane.
Defines whether the wedge corresponds to a dual array (Dual Linear Array, Dual Matrix Array) or a single one - Default value is SINGLE
Type of the wedge contact surface - PLANAR, SPHERICAL, CYLINDRICAL_MAJOR, CYLINDRICAL_MINOR - If missing PLANAR assumed
Wedge curvature radius - Concave : positive - Convex : negative - 0 in the case of a planar wedge - If missing 0 assumed.
Equivalent to L1, L2 and L3 (See Figure 15)
For a wedge, distance of the ultrasonic beam between the probe center and the index point (See Figure 15)
Defines the incident angle (See Figure 15)
wedge /skew angle (B) (See Figure 15)
wedge /disorientation angle (D) (See Figure 15)
For dual probes, inter-probes distance (L6) (See Figure 15)
For dual probes and only for dual probes defines the roof angle (See Figure 15)
For dual probes, squint angle (A2) (See Figure 15)
Defines whether the trajectory is spatially encoded or time encoded
For time encoded trajectories, defines the acquisition rate
List of positions and quaternions giving the positions and orientations of the trajectory frame at the different positions
When defining an acquisition grid, it is necessary to define a reference specimen that is either a cylinder or a plane.
Defines whether the grid is expressed in the inner surface of the cylinder or on the outer surface

2D Frame defining the U_GRID and V_GRID directions of the encoding in the surface representation of the specimen (X,Y) for planar specimens, (X,THETA) for cylindrical specimens. (1,0,) is assumed if missing
The specified values of the first coder at the different positions
The specified values of the second coder at the different positions. If missing while U_GRID_DATA is present, 1D array of data is assumed.
Defines whether the data is ordered in the same direction for each scan (COMB) or is inversed every second scan (RASTER)
Obtained encoder values on the u axis
Obtained encoder values on the v axis
For grid data, direction of the probe in the (u,v,w) coordinate system. Defaults to identity matrix.
Defines if the data are FULL_WAVE or RECTIFIED_POSITIVE, RECTIFIED_NEGATIVE, RECTIFIED_FULL
Defines the type of filtering applied to the signals : NO_FILTER, LOW_PASS, HIGH_PASS, BAND_PASS, OTHER
Optional datafield providing analogue filter parameters - see notes for detailed explanation
Description of the filtering applied

Each A-scan in a dataframe must be associated with both a transmit and a receive focal law through the datafields. These contain HDF5 references  to the groups which provide the detailed description of each focal laws (the same structure is used for both transmit and receive focal laws). Mandatory for phased array setups.

Each A-scan in a dataframe must be associated with both a transmit and a receive focal law through the datafields. These contain HDF5 references  to the groups which provide the detailed description of each focal laws (the same structure is used for both transmit and receive focal laws).Mandatory for phased array setups.
This indicates the sampling frequency of A-scan data points. It is assumed that a uniform sampling rate is used throughout A-scan data collection.
This indicates the starting time for data acquisition. If dimension is 1, the same start time is used for all A-Scans, else a different start time is specified for each A-Scan.
Digitization of the emission signal (can be used to store arbitrary  signals). If missing impulse emission at time 0.0 is assumed. 2D Array with one row for time and one for amplitude.
This indicates the total gain for each A-scan during reception. Multiplying factor that was applied at acquisition.
Pulse Repetition Frequency
TCG curve applied to the received signals. The amplitude correction is given for each time sample as a multiplying factor.
TCG curve applied to the received signals. The amplitude correction is given for each time sample as a multiplying factor.
Specifies the relative delay (in ultrasonic time) between the different Probe Element Combinations in the focal law. The default value is zero delay for all Probe Element Combinations.
Specifies the weighting between the different Probe Element Combinations in the focal law. The default is one for all Probe Element Combinations.

Represents the ultrasonic ray along which the data is to be represented in a true visualisation. It contains at least two points in the Probe Coordinates Frame corresponding to the start and end of the ray. (x,y,z) positions in Probe Coordinate Frame and time of flight are stored).
Mandatory if SEQUENCE_TYPE is ANGLE
Mandatory if SEQUENCE_TYPE is SSCAN
Mandatory if SEQUENCE_TYPE is SSCAN
Mandatory if SEQUENCE_TYPE is SSCAN

Mandatory if SEQUENCE_TYPE is ESCAN

Mandatory if SEQUENCE_TYPE is PWI
